content.text:
# Stefan Schwarz (politician)

| honorific_prefix    = MdB
| image               = Bundesarchiv B 145 Bild-F082407-0013, Bremen, CDU-Bundesparteitag.jpg
| caption             = Schwarz in 1989
| birth_name          = Stefan Schwarz
| parents             = Heinz Schwarz (father)
| birth_place         = Bonn, West Germany
| children            = 5
| office              = Member of the Bundestag  from Rhineland-Palatinate
| spouse              = Donika Gërvalla
| term_start          = 1990
| term_end            = 1994
| constituency        = Rhineland-Palatinate
| relations           = Jusuf Gërvalla (father-in-law)
| occupation          = Lobbyist, scientific assistant, politician
}}
Stefan Schwarz (; born 31 August 1959) is a German lobbyist, scientific assistant and former politician who served as a member of the Bundestag for the Christian Democratic Union from 1990 to 1994 representing Rhineland-Palatinate. He is married to Donika Gërvalla-Schwarz who currently serves as Second Deputy Prime Minister of Kosovo.
Life
Schwarz was born 31 August 1959 in Bonn, West Germany to Heinz Schwarz, a Rhineland-Palatinate state legislator and ministry of the interior. His older brother is the publicist Thomas Schwarz (b. 1957).
